name: py-amici

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Advanced Multilanguage Interface for CVODES and IDAS

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
NVPL BLAS (NVIDIA Performance Libraries BLAS) is part of NVIDIA
Performance Libraries that provides standard Fortran 77 BLAS APIs as
well as C (CBLAS).

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-mpmath
dependencies.description: A Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-python-libsbml
dependencies.description:
LibSBML is a library for reading, writing and manipulating the Systems
Biology Markup Language (SBML).

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-sympy
dependencies.description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.

dependencies.name: py-wurlitzer
dependencies.description: Capture C-level stdout/stderr pipes in Python via os.dup2.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependencies.name: swig
dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
